lines.text: Here's to women! They're all bad! They're deceitful! Hard! Calculating! But, oh - how fascinating!
There's nothing a woman resents so much as absolute trust. Oh, it's a dreadful commentary on her charms.
Do you know the lady?
The lady is my wife.
That's not answering my question.
All women kiss. Some for love, some for money, some because they think it's funny.
There's no virtue in a woman being good if she's never had a chance to be bad!
Well, aren't you going to kiss me goodnight?
NO.
That's too bad, Herbert, because this is one night I feel like being kissed.

I believe that lovemaking has been and always will be woman's work. Now if Tallulah works as hard for me after our marriage as she has before, I have a shrewd suspicion these old hands will never do another day's work!
If married women can chaperon other people, I don't know why they can't chaperon themselves!
The last woman I opened my heart to died laughing.
Only people with no imagination plan things. People like us just let them happen.
All right. Let's just let them happen.
[Final line]
Don't bet on women!
Woman is a child. Sometimes a sweet child. Sometimes a naughty child. But always a child. She can be lead, cajoled, bribed...
Pushed?
...Always it is a man who must guide her.
People who are too fond of each other often see too much of each other.
